name: Check if CloudFront distributions are set to HTTPS.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions are set to HTTPS.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions are using SNI to serve HTTPS requests.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions are using SNI to serve HTTPS requests.

name: CloudFront distributions should not point to non-existent S3 origins.
description: This control checks whether Amazon CloudFront distributions are pointing to non-existent Amazon S3 origins. The control fails if the origin is configured to point to a non-existent bucket.

name: Check if Geo restrictions are enabled in CloudFront distributions.
description: Check if Geo restrictions are enabled in CloudFront distributions.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions have origin failover enabled.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions have origin failover enabled.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions with S3 origin use OAC.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions use origin access control.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions have Field Level Encryption enabled.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions have Field Level Encryption enabled.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions have logging enabled.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions have logging enabled.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions are using deprecated SSL protocols.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions are using deprecated SSL protocols.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions encrypt traffic to custom origins.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions encrypt traffic to custom origins.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions have a default root object.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions have a default root object.

name: Check if CloudFront distributions are using WAF.
description: Check if CloudFront distributions are using WAF.

name: CloudFront distributions should use custom SSL/TLS certificates.
description: Ensure that your Amazon CloudFront distributions are configured to use a custom SSL/TLS certificate instead of the default one.
